News.headline: Match Report: York City 0 - 2 Dagenham & Redbridge
News.page_title: Match Report: York City 0 - 2 Dagenham & Redbridge
News.URL_keywords: Match Report: York City 0 - 2 Dagenham & Redbridge
News.short_description: Two first-half goals set Dagenham & Redbridge on their way to an impressive 2-0 win at York City in the National League.
News.description:
Daggers made three changes, with Scott Heard handed a first start, while Elliot Justham and Andre Boucaud were recalled to the line-up.

The visitors could have taken the lead in the seventh minute, but Corey Whitely’s shot from just inside the area was well saved by Scott Flinders.

Four minutes later, Justham showed good reactions to get down low and deny York striker Robbie McDaid from 15 yards.

With 24 minutes left in the half, Jordan Maguire-Drew saw his close-range shot blocked behind for a corner that Oliver Hawkins narrowly headed over.

Daggers took the lead in the 28th minute when Hawkins nodded in a brilliant ball from the right by Maguire-Drew.

On the stroke of half-time, Luke Guttridge doubled Daggers’ lead from close range after Maguire-Drew had flicked the ball into his path.

In the second half, though, Justham was required to pull off two saves in as many minutes with around a quarter of a hour gone to deny Aidan Connolly and Sean Newton.

With eight minutes remaining, the hosts had Adriano Moke sent off and from there, Daggers held on to win.

York (3-4-1-2): Flinders; Holmes, Klukowski, Fry; Heslop, Cooper, Moke, Newton; Connolly; Fenwick (Nti 58), McDaid (Rzcona 78).

Subs: Rooney, Dixon, Bruton.

Sent off: Moke 82 (violent conduct).

Daggers (4-2-3-1): Justham; Widdowson, Doe, Staunton, Raymond; Boucaud, Heard; Maguire-Drew (Benson 90+2), Guttridge, Whitely; Hawkins.

Subs: Cousins, Hyde, Barnwell, Mitchell.

Attendance: 2,410 (including 131 Daggers fans)

Referee: Martin Coy
